statement:
If $\mathbb{F}_q$ is a finite field with $q$ elements, then the general
linear group $\operatorname{GL}(n, \mathbb{F}_q)$ over the field
$\mathbb{F}_q$

1.  is a finite group of order
    $\lvert \operatorname{GL}(n, \mathbb{F}_q) \rvert = \prod_{i=0}^{n-1}(q^n-q^i)$,
    and

2.  $[\operatorname{GL}(n,\mathbb{F}_q),\operatorname{GL}(n,\mathbb{F}_q)] = \operatorname{SL}(n,\mathbb{F}_q)$
    where $[,]$ is the commutator bracket with the exception of
    $\operatorname{SL}(2,\mathbb{F}_2)$.
names: theorems of general linear group over a finite field
